intro: Erysimum munzuriense, commonly known as the desert wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its bright yellow or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has hairy, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. Erysimum munzuriense is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it contributes to the ecological diversity of these regions.
